intro: Armeria villosa subsp. alcaracensis, commonly known as the Alcaraceñas thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that produces dense clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant features silver-gray foliage with soft, woolly hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal habitats. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in Mediterranean climates.
